newsitem.title: AUSTRIA: Niki Lauda markets himself as a rat.
newsitem.headline: Niki Lauda markets himself as a rat.

text.p: Fans of Austrian formula one racer turned airline boss Niki Lauda can now take their idol to bed in the form of a cuddly rat.

Niki the Rat, made by German toymakers Steiff, is 37 cm (15 inches) high and weighs 130 grammes (4.6 oz), Austrian television reported on Thursday. He comes complete with gnawing teeth, red overalls, black boxer shorts and Lauda's trademark red baseball cap.
"The rat was always my role model in the animal kingdom, with its high intelligence and instinct for survival," Lauda said at the presentation of the soft toy.
The retail price for the cuddly rat is 1,190 schillings ($100).
